body: Julian Samson Greenspun, a Manhattan lawyer and former justice of the New York State Supreme Court in Brooklyn, died on Nov. 21 at Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center. He was 63 and lived in Mill Basin, Brooklyn. The cause was gallbladder cancer, his family said. Mr. Greenspun was born in Brooklyn and graduated from Brooklyn Law School. He was
title: Julian S. Greenspun, New York Judge, 63

body: LOOK, look. See Dick in a museum. See Jane in a documentary. See copies of ''Fun With Dick and Jane'' rescued from oblivion after years of use by sticky-fingered first-graders, selling for $300. The Dick and Jane stories, which taught millions of schoolchildren for 40 years to read with simple vocabulary and sunny narrative pictures, are being
title: 'Oh, Jane, See How Popular We Are'

body: THE ultimate New York Web site has arrived: www.pastrami.com. No, it is not an interactive sandwich on rye. It is the Internet address of the Mill Basin Kosher Deli and Fine Art Gallery in Brooklyn, where kasha varnishkes and sour pickles are served in a dining room adorned with Ertes, James Rizzis and Alphonse Muchas. These days, it is harder to
title: Give Me Your Wired

body: For the second consecutive summer, the Board of Education is scrambling to cope with a self-inflicted staffing headache: the departure of thousands of the most experienced teachers in New York City's public schools, who are planning to retire early under a buyout program. The loss of nearly 10 percent of the city's 64,000 teachers within 14 months
title: Buyouts Leave School Board Racing to Fill 3,000 Jobs

body: The Chicken Man looked out over the ditch full of dark green water that juts into South Brooklyn like a broken finger. "Maybe there will be a barge today," he said. But as he surveyed the unnaturally glassy surface of the Gowanus Canal and listened to the radio static in his bridge tower, the Chicken Man -- Leonard C. Thomas only to his employers
title: This Is the Life: Raise Bridge. Cook Chicken.;Unsung Chef Dreams Big High Above the Gowanus

body: To hundreds of pensioners who had worked for the Roman Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn, she was known simply as Vinny, and during the last six years, hers was often the reassuring voice on the phone when they called with questions about their monthly checks. Though she juggled broad fiscal responsibilities as the manager of the diocesan pension office
title: Catholic Officials Suspect Longtime Worker in Thefts

body: In the following reports, the "listed at" price is the asking price when negotiations began that ended in the sale. Time on market is from most recent listing to contract. MANHATTAN BATTERY PARK $253,900 380 Rector Place (Liberty Place) 1-bedroom, 1-bath, 707-sq.-ft. condo in a 9-year-old building; 24-hr. doormen, concierge, health club, harbor
title: Residential Resales

body: Scotland in a Bottle Why did Jim Milne, the blender for Justerini & Brooks, the company that makes J & B Scotch, decide to try to assemble a blend of every whisky distilled in Scotland? Why do people climb Mount Everest? "I thought about it many years ago," he said, "and the idea would not go away." He set to work in earnest about three years ago,
title: Food Notes

body: Two men were found shot to death in the front seat of a rental sedan yesterday morning in the Mill Basin section of Brooklyn, victims of an apparent organized-crime attack, the police said. The men, Robert Arena and Thomas Maranga, both 26, were found slumped on the front seat and had been shot several times in the head and body, the police said. A
title: 2 Found Shot Dead In a Car in Brooklyn

body: The declaration was of triumph, if not total independence: Sanitation Department officials, conceding that the gargantuan amounts of snow in the city still posed enduring problems, said nonetheless that every street in the city had been plowed by yesterday -- except for the several dozen streets blocked by abandoned cars. "One hundred percent,"
title: THE BLIZZARD OF 1996: PLOWING;Snowbanks Aside, the Sanitation Department Declares a Victory
